snippet: The claims increased 3,000, to 270,000 for the week ended Aug. 1. It was the 22nd consecutive week that they held below the 300,000 threshold.
abstract: Labor Dept reports weekly applications for unemployment benefits rose 3,000 to seasonally adjusted 270,000; growth is smaller than expected, indicating continued tightening of that labor market conditions.
lead_paragraph: The claims increased 3,000, to 270,000 for the week ended Aug. 1. It was the 22nd consecutive week that they held below the 300,000 threshold.

headline.main: Jobless Claims Rise, but Less Than Expected
headline.print_headline: Jobless Claims Rise, but Less Than Expected
